column4: I am interested in a way to run Ubuntu at the same time as my windows.
I have development environments running on my windows that I can't turn off. But I tried running Ubuntu in a VM using Virtualbox and it would only go to like 1024 pixels.
Are other virtual environments better? I was hoping to just run it fullscreen and be able to almost forget about the windows running.
Ubottu if I dual boot I am not running them side by side.
if you install the virtualbox guest additions/extensions in windows - you'll get full resolution amongst other things
Yeah, but 800x600 was the largest in Windowsbox.
My buddy installed something in ubuntu that made it go to 1024 I think.
actually, otherway around - install the VB extensions in ubuntu
VB extensions? What are those for?
the extensions are needed to give you full resolution (and other things like sound, networking, etc)
no, they're called "VirtualBox Guest Additions" - part of virtualbox itself, they need to be installed in ubuntu
So VB should be able to run fullscreen at 1900 pixels?
I have never played a computer game. :-)
in the VB menu, Devices -> Install Guest Additions -- see http://linuxandfriends.com/2009/02/12/installing-virtualbox-guest-additions-in-ubuntu-linux/
